Detailed Description

template<class Iter>
class Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >

SylphIterator provides a easier-to-use wrapper around STL iterators.

The interface of a SylphIterator is similar to a Java-style iterator, but it is backed by a STL iterator and can therefore be used for any class supporitng STL iterators.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class Iter >
Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::SylphIterator ( Iter &  it  )  [inline]

Creates a new Iterator from an STL-iterator.

An Iterator can either be constructed explicitly with this constructor, in which case the correct type of Iterator for the particular collection needs to be known, or through Iterable::iterator() or Iterable::mutableIterator() .

Parameters:
it The iterable to iterate over.

template<class Iter >
virtual Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::~SylphIterator (  )  [inline, virtual]

Destructor.

This destructor does nothing.

Member Function Documentation

template<class Iter >
virtual void Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::back (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Moves the Iterator to the place "after" the last item, that is, it gives the pointer in the iterator such a value that hasNext returns false.

This method is useful for backward iterating, i.e. 

Iterator it = coll.getIterator(); // normal 'forward' iterator
 it.back(); // ready for backward iteration

template<class Iter >
virtual void Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::front (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Moves the Iterator to the place "before" the first item, that is, it gives the pointer in the iterator such a value that hasPrevious returns false.

Note:
This requires that the backing iterator is a bidirectional iterator.

template<class Iter >
virtual bool Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::hasNext (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Checks if this iterator has any more entries in forward direction.

Returns:
true if there are more entries, false otherwise.

template<class Iter >
virtual bool Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::hasPrevious (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Checks if this iterator has any more entries in backward direction.

Returns:
true if there are more entries, false otherwise.
Note:
This requires that the backing iterator is a bidirectional iterator.

template<class Iter >
virtual const Iter::reference Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::next (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns the next entry in the forward direction and moves the iterator one place forward.

Exceptions:
Exception if there are no more entries.
Returns:
The next entry

template<class Iter >
virtual std::idx_t Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::nextIndex (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns the next index of the Iterable in the forward direction.

Exceptions:
Exception if there are no more entries.
Returns:
The next index in the Iterable
Note:
This method requires the backing iterator to be a random-access iterator.

template<class Iter >

Synoynmous for next().

Note:
No copy of this iterator is made.

template<class Iter >
const Iter::reference Sylph::SylphIterator< Iter >::operator-- ( int   )  const [inline]

Synonymous for previous().

Note:
No copy is of this iterator is made.

The previous entry
Note:
